In mathlib4, the notation for conjunction and disjunction of FirstOrder.Language.Formula uses the same notation of Heynting algebra. In that case, wouldn't it be more appropriate to use the notation of HImp for implication instead of ⟹ ?

Furthermore, there is dissatisfaction with notation both ⟹ for firt-order logic and the notation ⇨ for HImp. This is because the double arrow is conventionally used for meta-logical implication (see, for example, this), so I think it should not be used in formalized logics like first-order logic or Heyting algebras (despite the meta-logical implication being represented as → in lean4). For instance, what about using ➝ for the formalized logic implication? I would like to hear everyone's opinions on this.
Palalansoukî has marked this topic as resolved.
